name: data-society_discover-the-menu
title: Discover The Menu
description:
Data includes 45,000 menus from the 1840s to the present.

## Data generated through NYPL's crowdsourcing project *What's on the menu?*

Here you will find The New York Public Library's transcribed historical restaurant menus, dish by dish, so that they can be searched by what people were eating back in the day. With approximately 45,000 menus dating from the 1840s to the present, The New York Public Library’s restaurant menu collection is one of the largest in the world, used by historians, chefs, novelists and everyday food enthusiasts. 

The New York Public Library’s menu collection, housed in the Rare Book Division, originated through the energetic efforts of Miss Frank E. Buttolph (1850-1924), who, in 1900, began to collect menus on the Library's behalf. Miss Buttolph added more than 25,000 menus to the collection, before leaving the Library in 1924. The collection has continued to grow through additional gifts of graphic, gastronomic, topical, or sociological interest, especially but not exclusively New York-related. The collection now contains approximately 45,000 items, about quarter of which have so far been digitized and made available in the [NYPL Digital Gallery](https://digitalcollections.nypl.org/collections/the-buttolph-collection-of-menus#/?tab=about).

The Rare Books Division of The New York Public Library houses approximately 200,000 titles, covering five centuries of printing—from the 1450s to the present—and representing Continental Europe, England, and the Americas.

There's a lot of data behind What's on the Menu?: a mix of simple bibliographic description of the menus (created by The New York Public Library) and the culinary and economic content of the menus themselves (transcribed by volunteers).

For more information about each file, check the ```readme.txt```.

__These data are updated on the 1st and 16th of every month.__

## License

> No known copyright restrictions on this material. We ask that you credit The New York Public Library as source on any applications or publications.

__*Source:*__ http://menus.nypl.org/data

fields.name: id
fields.title: id
fields.description: a unique identifier for this dish

fields.name: name
fields.title: name
fields.description: the name of this dish

fields.name: description
fields.title: description
fields.description: a description of this dish; always blank as of 2016-11-01 release

fields.name: menus_appeared
fields.title: menus_appeared
fields.description: the number of menus this dish appears on

fields.name: times_appeared
fields.title: times_appeared
fields.description: the number of times this dish appears (seems to be in case the dish appears multiple times or in multiple sections on a given menu)

fields.name: first_appeared
fields.title: first_appeared
fields.description: the year this dish first appeared; sometimes 0 or 1, which should probably be treated as errors or NA

fields.name: last_appeared
fields.title: last_appeared
fields.description: the year this dish last appeared; sometimes 2928, 0, or 1, which should probably be treated as errors or NA

fields.name: lowest_price
fields.title: lowest_price
fields.description: the lowest price that this item was sold for

fields.name: highest_price
fields.title: highest_price
fields.description: the highest price that this item was sold for

fields.name: id
fields.title: id
fields.description: a unique identifier for this menu

fields.name: name
fields.title: name
fields.description: a name for this menu (often blank, or the name of the restaurant)

fields.name: sponsor
fields.title: sponsor
fields.description: the sponsor of this menu (often the name of the restaurant)

fields.name: event
fields.title: event
fields.description: the event this menu was created for (typically the name of the meal, or the special event that this menu was created for)

fields.name: venue
fields.title: venue
fields.description: the venue where food from this menu was served

fields.name: place
fields.title: place
fields.description: geographical description of the menu's location; often includes city/state/country, street address, or name of venue

fields.name: physical_description
fields.title: physical_description
fields.description: a description of the menu's physical characteristics, including paper stock, dimensions, colors, design, etc.

fields.name: occasion
fields.title: occasion
fields.description: a special occasion, holiday, daily, or blank

fields.name: notes
fields.title: notes
fields.description: any special notes about this menu

fields.name: call_number
fields.title: call_number
fields.description: the menu's call number within the NYPL collection

fields.name: keywords
fields.title: keywords
fields.description: keywords for the menu; always blank as of 2016-11-01 release

fields.name: language
fields.title: language
fields.description: language the menu is printed in; always blank as of 2016-11-01 release

fields.name: date
fields.title: date
fields.description: date the menu was collected, as a string with the format YYYY-MM-DD

fields.name: location
fields.title: location
fields.description: location where the menu was used

fields.name: location_type
fields.title: location_type
fields.description: type of the location value; always blank as of 2016-11-01 release

fields.name: currency
fields.title: currency
fields.description: currency (possibly obsolete) charged for items on this menu

fields.name: currency_symbol
fields.title: currency_symbol
fields.description: symbol for the currency

fields.name: status
fields.title: status
fields.description: the digitization/transcription status of this menu; one of "complete" or "under review"

fields.name: page_count
fields.title: page_count
fields.description: number of pages in this menu

fields.name: dish_count
fields.title: dish_count
fields.description: number of dishes on this menu

fields.name: id
fields.title: id
fields.description: a unique identifier for this menu item

fields.name: menu_page_id
fields.title: menu_page_id
fields.description: the id of the menu page that this item appears (see Cross-table reference notes)

fields.name: price
fields.title: price
fields.description: the price of (the smallest portion of) this item

fields.name: high_price
fields.title: high_price
fields.description: the price of the largest portion of this item

fields.name: dish_id
fields.title: dish_id
fields.description: the id of the dish that this menu item refers to (see Cross-table reference notes)

fields.name: created_at
fields.title: created_at
fields.description: the date and time that this database entry was created

fields.name: updated_at
fields.title: updated_at
fields.description: the most recent date that this database entry was updated

fields.name: xpos
fields.title: xpos
fields.description: the x-axis position of the item on the scanned image

fields.name: ypos
fields.title: ypos
fields.description: the y-axis position of the item on the scanned image

fields.name: id
fields.title: id
fields.description: a unique identifier for this menu page

fields.name: menu_id
fields.title: menu_id
fields.description: the id of the menu this page belongs to (see Cross-table reference notes)

fields.name: page_number
fields.title: page_number
fields.description: the page number in the menu

fields.name: image_id
fields.title: image_id
fields.description: a unique identifier for the scanned image of this menu page, accessible on the NYPL site

fields.name: full_height
fields.title: full_height
fields.description: the height of the menu

fields.name: full_width
fields.title: full_width
fields.description: the width of the menu

fields.name: uuid
fields.title: uuid
fields.description: a(nother) unique identifier for this page/image
